template.name: Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze
template.description:
Modelo Cisco Nexus 9000 Series
MIBs usados: CISCO-ENHANCED-MEMPOOL-MIB CISCO-ENTITY-FRU-CONTROL-MIB CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB CISCO-PROCESS-MIB ENTITY-MIB EtherLike-MIB IF-MIB SNMPv2-MIB SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB CISCO-IMAGE-MIB
Você pode discutir este modelo ou deixar comentários em nosso fórum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/418396-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-templates-for-cisco
Versão da ferramenta de modelo usada: 0,41

trigger.name: Indisponível para ping ICMP
trigger.description: As últimas três tentativas retornaram um tempo limite. Verifique a conectividade de um dispositivo.

trigger.expression: min(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: Alta perda de ping ICMP
Tempo de resposta de ping ICMP alto

dependency.name: Alta perda de ping ICMP
dependency.expression: min(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all the SNMP traps unmatched by the other snmptrap items.

item.name: Detalhes de contato do sistema
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB. A identificação textual da pessoa de contato para o nó gerenciado (ou: este nó), juntamente com as informações de contato dessa pessoa. Se nenhuma informação de contato for conhecida, o valor será uma string de comprimento zero.

item.name: Descrição do Sistema
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB. A descrição textual da entidade. Esse valor deve incluir o nome completo e o número de identificação da versão do tipo de hardware do sistema, do sistema operacional do software e do software de rede.

trigger.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.hw.serialnumber)=1 and length(last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: O dispositivo foi substituído
trigger.event_name: O dispositivo foi substituído (novo número de série recebido)
trigger.description: O número de série de um dispositivo foi alterado. Confirme para fechar manualmente.

item.name: Localização do Sistema
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB. The physical location of this node (e.g., telephone closet, the third floor). If the location is unknown, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: Nome do Sistema
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB. The administratively-assigned name for this node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is a zero-length string.

trigger.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.name)=1 and length(last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.name))>0
trigger.name: O nome do sistema mudou
trigger.description: O nome do sistema mudou. Confirme para fechar manualmente.

item.name: ID Do Sistema
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB. The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprise's subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining "what kind of box" is being managed. For example, if the vendor "Flintstones, Inc." was assigned the subtree 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its "Fred Router".

trigger.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.sw.os)=1 and length(last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.sw.os))>0
trigger.name: A descrição do sistema operacional mudou
trigger.description: A descrição do sistema operacional mudou. Possíveis razões pelas quais o sistema foi atualizado ou substituído. Confirme para fechar manualmente.

dependency.name: O nome do sistema mudou
dependency.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.name)=1 and length(last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.name))>0

item.name: Tempo de atividade (snmp)
item.description: MIB: SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB::snmpEngineTime. The number of seconds since the value of the `snmpEngineBoots` object has had a last change. When incrementing this object's value would cause it to exceed its maximum, the `snmpEngineBoots` is incremented as if a re-initialization had occurred, and this object's value consequently reverts to zero.

trigger.name: O dispositivo foi reiniciado ou reinicializado
trigger.description: O registro de SNMP Boots mudou em menos de 10 minutos. A reinicialização de um dispositivo também conta.

trigger.name: Nenhuma coleta de dados SNMP
trigger.description: O SNMP não está disponível para polling. Verifique a conectividade de um dispositivo e as configurações de SNMP.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de CPU
discovery_rule.description: Você deve usar CISCO-PROCESS-MIB e seu objeto `cpmCPUTotal5minRev` da tabela chamada `cpmCPUTotalTable`, e indexado com `cpmCPUTotalPhysicalIndex`. A tabela `cpmCPUTotalTable` permite que o CISCO-PROCESS-MIB mantenha as estatísticas de CPU para diferentes entidades físicas no roteador, como diferentes chips de CPU, um grupo de CPUs ou CPUs em diferentes módulos/placas. No caso de uma única CPU, o `cpmCPUTotalTable` possui apenas uma entrada.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: Utilização de CPU
item_prototype.description:
MIB: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB The object name: `cpmCPUTotal5minRev`
The MIB object `cpmCPUTotal5minRev` provides a more accurate view of the performance of the router over time than the MIB objects `cpmCPUTotal1minRev` and `cpmCPUTotal5secRev`. These MIB objects are not accurate because they look at the CPU with an interval of one minute and five seconds, respectively. These MIBs enable to monitor the trends and plan the capacity of your network. The recommended baseline rising threshold for the `cpmCPUTotal5minRev` is 90 percent. Depending on the platform, some routers that run at 90 percent, for example, 2500 series can exhibit performance degradation versus a high-end router, for example, the 7500 series, which can operate fine.

trigger_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de números de série da entidade
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of serial numbers of the entities from ENTITY-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB. The object name: `entPhysicalSerialNum`. The vendor-specific serial number string for the physical entity. The preferred value is the serial number string actually printed on the component itself (if present).

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.hw.serialnumber[{#SNMPINDEX}])=1 and length(last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/system.hw.serialnumber[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: O dispositivo foi substituído
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#ENT_NAME}: O dispositivo foi substituído (novo número de série recebido)
trigger_prototype.description: The device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close manually.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta Fan status
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of metrics for the fan's status from ENTITY-MIB and CISCO-ENTITY-FRU-CONTROL-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Status operacional do Fan

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Fan está em um estado desconhecido
trigger_prototype.description: The fan unit requires attention.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Fan OFF
trigger_prototype.description: The fan unit requires immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: O ventilador está em estado de aviso
trigger_prototype.description: The fan unit requires attention.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de Memoria
discovery_rule.description: A descoberta de `ciscoMemoryPoolTable` - a tabela que contém as entradas de monitoramento do pool de memória. Para obter mais detalhes, consulte "Como obter o maior bloco de memória contígua livre usando SNMP": http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Memoria livre
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENHANCED-MEMPOOL-MIB. The object name: `cempMemPoolFree`. It indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the physical entity.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Memoria em uso
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENHANCED-MEMPOOL-MIB. The object name: `cempMemPoolUsed`. It indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the physical entity.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Alto uso de memória
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de interfaces de rede
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of interfaces from IF-MIB.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Pacotes de entrada descartados
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The number of inbound packets, which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be the necessity to free up the buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Pacotes de entrada com erros
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alta taxa de erro de entrada
trigger_prototype.event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alta taxa de erro de entrada ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} por 20m)
trigger_prototype.description: It recovers when it goes below 80% of the {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits recebidos
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Pacotes de saída descartados
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The number of outbound packets, which were chosen to be discarded, even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Pacotes de saída com erros
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alta taxa de erro de saída
trigger_prototype.event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alta taxa de erro de saída ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} por 20m)
trigger_prototype.description: It recovers when it goes below 80% of the {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits enviados
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of the ifOutOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of the ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Velocidade
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of "n", then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range from n-500,000 to n+499,999. For the interfaces, which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer, which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Status Operacional
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The current operational state of the interface: - The testing (3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed. - If ifAdminStatus is down (2), then ifOperStatus should be down (2). - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up (1), then ifOperStatus should change to up (1), provided the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic. - It should change to dormant (5) if the interface is waiting for external actions, such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection. - It should remain in the down (2) state if and only when there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up (1) state. - It should remain in the notPresent (6) state if the interface has missing components (typically, hardware).

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. Use $IFCONTROL macro with context "{#IFNAME}" to void trigger firing on specific interfaces. Values: - 0 : Marks an interface as not important. Trigger does not fire when interface is down. - 1 : Default value to fire the trigger when interface is down 3. change(//net.if.status[{#IFNAME}]) - condition prevents firing of trigger if status did not change. It helps in cases, when interfaces were initially down. BEWARE, manual close will ceasefire until at least two status changes happens again!

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Tipo de Interface
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB. The type of an interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and find(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"regexp","^(6|7|11|62|69|117)$") and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): A Ethernet mudou para uma velocidade mais baixa do que antes
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of issues with autonegotiation. Ack to close manually.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.in[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.in[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alto uso de largura de banda de entrada
trigger_prototype.event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alto uso de largura de banda de entrada ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.out[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.out[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alto uso de largura de banda de saída
trigger_prototype.event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Alto uso de largura de banda de saída ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link OFF
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and change(/Cisco Nexus 9000 - Edit by ze/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta EtherLike
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of interfaces from IF-MIB and EtherLike-MIB. The interfaces that have up (1) operational status are discovered.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Duplex status
item_prototype.description: MIB: EtherLike-MIB. The object name: dot3StatsDuplexStatus. The current mode of operation of the MAC entity 'unknown' indicates that the current duplex mode could not be determined. The management control of the duplex mode is accomplished through the MAU MIB. When the interface does not support autonegotiation, or when autonegotiation is not enabled, the duplex mode is controlled using ifMauDefaultType. When autonegotiation is supported and enabled, duplex mode is controlled using ifMauAutoNegAdvertisedBits. In either case, the currently operating duplex mode is reflected in both: in this object and in ifMauType. Note that this object provides redundant information with ifMauType. Normally, redundant objects are discouraged. However, in this instance, it allows the management application to determine the duplex status of an interface without having to know every possible value of ifMauType. This was felt to be sufficiently valuable to justify the redundancy. For the reference see: [IEEE 802.3 Std.], 30.3.1.1.32, aDuplexStatus.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Modo half-duplex
trigger_prototype.description: Check the autonegotiation settings and cabling.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de PSU
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of power supplies from ENTITY-MIB and CISCO-ENTITY-FRU-CONTROL-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Status da fonte de alimentação

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A PSU está desligada: Administrativamente
trigger_prototype.description: The FRU is administratively off.

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: PSU está em estado de falha

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A PSU está desligada ou fora do estado ideal

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: PSU está em estado de falha

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: PSU está em estado de falha
trigger_prototype.description: The FRU is in a failed state.

discovery_rule.name: Descoberta de sensores de temperatura
discovery_rule.description: A descoberta de sensores de temperatura de CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB e ENTITY-MIB. Os sensores que possuem celsius (8) `entSensorType` são descobertos. A escala de valores coletados é retirada do `entSensorScale` e aplicada no pré-processamento do item.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Sensor de temperatura
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB. The object name: entSensorStatus. This variable indicates the present operational status of the sensor. Possible values: - ok (1): means the agent can read the sensor value; - unavailable (2): means that the agent presently can not report the sensor value; - nonoperational (3) means that the agent believes the sensor is broken. The sensor could have a hard failure (e.g., disconnected wire), or a soft failure (e.g., out-of-range, jittery, or wildly fluctuating readings).

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: O sensor de temperatura não está disponível
trigger_prototype.description: It means that the agent presently can not report the sensor value.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: O sensor de temperatura não está operacional
trigger_prototype.description: It means that the agent considers that the sensor is broken. The sensor could have a hard failure (e.g., disconnected wire), or a soft failure (e.g., out-of-range, jittery, or wildly fluctuating readings).

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperatura
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB. The object name: entSensorValue. This variable reports the most recent measurement seen by the sensor.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A temperatura está acima do limite crítico
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#SNMPVALUE}:A temperatura está acima do limite crítico: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}°C
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses the values of the temperature sensor.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A temperatura está acima do limite permitido
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A temperatura está acima do limite permitido: >{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}°C"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses the values of the temperature sensor.

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A temperatura está acima do limite crítico

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: A temperatura está muito baixa

macro.description: It leaves only the matching fan names as indicated in the filter string.
It leaves only the matching power supply names as indicated in the filter string.
The filter excludes chassis (3) class from Serial discovery. The chassis (3) are polled with a regular item.
The filter retrieves only existing serial number strings.
If the administrative status is down (2), then an interface is excluded.
It filters out `loopbacks`, `nulls`, `docker veth` links and `docker0 bridge` by default.
If the operational status is `notPresent (6)`, then an interface is excluded.
The PSU states list for average trigger priority.
